comments:
We're seeing the following AssertionFailedException which I believe is the
result of null LogEntry objects being returned from the LogView's fLogs
ArrayList. My expectation is that the LogView class should prevent this internal
list from containing nulls. Let me know if my interpretation of this stack is
wrong or if you think client code could be at fault here. thanks, Rob

Looks like we've got some internal tests blocked on this issue so if someone has
a chance to give this one a quick scan, that would be much appreciated (I tried
to up the priority but bugzilla is not letting me...) Thanks, Rob
all we have is a stack.  do you have reproducible steps?

Unfortunately, I don't have a clear repro scenario at this point; the problem
has been seen sporadically during an automated test (in this case it was
triggered by the completion of a wizard that creates a new project); I realize
the stack doesn't give you much info but was hoping it might be enough to enable
confirmation of my thinking that the assertion is due to null LogEntry objects
returned by the LogView class, determination of whether this assertion has been
seen under other scenarios and potentially determination of whether it more
likely represents an error in client code or a error in eclipse code. Whatever
insight you can provide will be very much appreciated. thanks, Rob
I'll take a look and see if such a scenario can occur.

LogView#getLogs() could theoretically be called before fLogs get initialized 
causing an NPE.

Fixed.  Thanks for reporting.
